content.description: Start matched in v-shaped notch. Cross over with left to good edge and make big move out right to small pocket/crimp (crux)...figure out your way to the top.
content.location: South side of mountain in cluster...see beta photo.

content.description: Climb up face for an easy warmup...tread lightly as there is still some loose rock
content.location: west side of boulder with "not guilty"...see beta photo

content.description: Short & slightly overhanging. Start undercling on jug. Hit the pocket on the arete with left, cross with right to top..top out. Pretty solid rock for the area, removed a bad chunk from topout.
content.location: One of the first rock clusters on south side of mountain. Follow 'path' from parking lot and you'll see it half-way up the slope.

content.description: Climb bulge, then head to the top...fairly solid.
content.location: South side of boulder with "Jury and Not Guilty"

content.description: Awesome winter bouldering potential with in an hour of the valley. I was hiking around the base of courthouse rock saw these monsterous  boulders that fits roughly into a 5 achier area and about three times as many boulders as the Bend Boulders outside  Moab.  I found no chalk on them. The rock quality is every bit as hard as Heuco. I'm talking solid rock!!! Short and steep, to test piece heady high balls, caves, 45 degree walls, it has it all.  Boulders ranging from 10' to 35'. The rock is bomber!!! The view is spectacular, with amazing sunsets. You won't see a soul out there so bring spotters!! Landings for the most part are relatively flat.
